Package biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2

Class LessOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.LessOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    public class LessOptions
extends Object
implements Serializable

    Represents Less compiler options responsible for controlling the LessCompiler compilation process.

    Base options:

    • compress - whether a CSS code should be compressed (default: false)
    • IE compatibility - whether a CSS code should be compatible with Internet Explorer browser (default: true)
    • included paths - available include paths (default: [])
    • JavaScript - whether a compiler should allow usage of JavaScript language (default: true)
    • line numbers - whether a compiler should generate inline source-mapping (default: LineNumbersValue.OFF)
    • relative URLs - whether a compiler should rewrite relative URLs (default: false)
    • root path - a path which will be added to every generated import and URL in CSS code (default: null)
    • silent - whether a compiler shouldn't log compilation warnings (default: false)
    • strict imports - whether a compiler should disallow an @import operation inside of either @media blocks or other selector blocks (default: false)
    • strict math - whether a compiler should try and process all maths in Less code (default: false)
    • strict units - whether a compiler should guess units in Less code when it does maths (default: false)

    Source Map options:

    • base path - a path that will be removed from each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also from the path to the map file specified in your output CSS (default: null)
    • Less inline - whether a compiler should include all of the Less files in to the Source Map (default: false)
    • root path - a path that will be prepended to each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also to the path to the map file specified in your output CSS (default: null)
    • URL - a path which will overwrite the URL in the CSS that points at the Source Map file (default: null)

    Additional options:

    • banner - a banner which will be inserted to a source file before the compilation
    • globalVariables - variables that can be referenced by the files
    • modifyVariables - variables that can overwrite variables defined in the files

    Non-standard options:

    • encoding - an encoding used to read source files and save generated code (default: null - means platform default encoding)
    • file systems - a list with file systems (default: ["biz.gabrys.lesscss.compiler2.filesystem.LocalFileSystem"])
    Since:
    2.0.0
    See Also:
    LessOptionsBuilder, FileSystemOptionsBuilder, LessVariableOptionsBuilder, Serialized Form

      • getIncludePaths

        public List<String> getIncludePaths()
        Returns available include paths (default: []). If the file in an @import rule does not exist at that exact location, a compiler will look for it at the location(s) passed to this option. You might use this for instance to specify a path to a library which you want to be referenced simply and relatively in the less files.
        Returns:
        the available include paths (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setIncludePaths

        public void setIncludePaths​(List<String> includePaths)
        Sets available include paths (default: []). If the file in an @import rule does not exist at that exact location, a compiler will look for it at the location(s) passed to this option. You might use this for instance to specify a path to a library which you want to be referenced simply and relatively in the less files.
        Parameters:
        includePaths - the available include paths (null is treated as an empty collection).
        Since:
        2.0.0

        the line numbers value (never null).

      • getRootPath

        public String getRootPath()
        Returns a path which will be added to every generated import and URL in CSS code (default: null). This does not affect less import statements that are processed, just ones that are left in the output CSS.

        For instance, if all the images the CSS use are in a folder called resources, you can use this option to add this on to the URL's and then have the name of that folder configurable.

        Returns:
        the path which will be added.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setRootPath

        public void setRootPath​(String rootPath)
        Sets a path which will be added to every generated import and URL in CSS code (default: null). This does not affect less import statements that are processed, just ones that are left in the output CSS.

        For instance, if all the images the CSS use are in a folder called resources, you can use this option to add this on to the URL's and then have the name of that folder configurable.

        Parameters:
        rootPath - the path which will be added.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • isRelativeUrls

        public boolean isRelativeUrls()
        Checks whether a compiler should rewrite relative URLs (default: false). By default URLs are kept as-is, so if you import a file in a sub-directory that references an image, exactly the same URL will be output in the CSS code. This option allows you to re-write URLs in imported files so that the URL is always relative to the base imported file. Example: 
         # main.less
 @import "files/backgrounds.less";
 
 # files/backgrounds.less
 .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        this will output the following normally 

         .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        but with this option on it will instead output 

         .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('files/images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        You may also want to consider using the data-uri function instead of this option, which will embed images into the CSS.

        Returns:
        true whether the compiler should rewrite relative URLs, otherwise false.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setRelativeUrls

        public void setRelativeUrls​(boolean relativeUrls)
        Sets whether a compiler should rewrite relative URLs (default: false). By default URLs are kept as-is, so if you import a file in a sub-directory that references an image, exactly the same URL will be output in the CSS code. This option allows you to re-write URLs in imported files so that the URL is always relative to the base imported file. Example: 
         # main.less
 @import "files/backgrounds.less";
 
 # files/backgrounds.less
 .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        this will output the following normally 

         .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        but with this option on it will instead output 

         .icon-1 {
     background-image: url('files/images/lamp-post.png');
 }

        You may also want to consider using the data-uri function instead of this option, which will embed images into the CSS.

        Parameters:
        relativeUrls - true whether the compiler should rewrite relative URLs, otherwise false.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • isStrictMath

        public boolean isStrictMath()
        Checks whether a compiler should try and process all maths in Less code (default: false). By default the compiler will try and process all maths in your Less e.g.: 
         .class {
     height: calc(100% - 10px);
 }

        will be processed currently.

        With this option enabled, only maths that is inside unnecessary parenthesis will be processed. Example: 

         .class {
     width: calc(100% - ((10px  - 5px)));
     height: (100px / 4px);
     font-size: 1 / 4;
 }

        will be compiled to 

         .class {
     width: calc(100% - 5px);
     height: 25px;
     font-size: 1 / 4;
 }
        Returns:
        true whether the compiler should try and process all maths in the Less code, otherwise false.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        isStrictUnits()

      • setStrictMath

        public void setStrictMath​(boolean strictMath)
        Sets whether a compiler should try and process all maths in Less code (default: false). By default the compiler will try and process all maths in your Less e.g.: 
         .class {
     height: calc(100% - 10px);
 }

        will be processed currently.

        With this option enabled, only maths that is inside unnecessary parenthesis will be processed. Example: 

         .class {
     width: calc(100% - ((10px  - 5px)));
     height: (100px / 4px);
     font-size: 1 / 4;
 }

        will be compiled to 

         .class {
     width: calc(100% - 5px);
     height: 25px;
     font-size: 1 / 4;
 }
        Parameters:
        strictMath - true whether the compiler should try and process all maths in the Less code, otherwise false.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        setStrictUnits(boolean)

      • isStrictUnits

        public boolean isStrictUnits()
        Checks whether a compiler should guess units in Less code when it does maths (default: false). By default the compiler attempts to guess at the output unit when it does maths. For instance: 
         .class {
     property: 1px * 2px;
 }

        In this case, things are clearly not right - a length multiplied by a length gives an area, but CSS does not support specifying areas. So we assume that the user meant for one of the values to be a value, not a unit of length and Less outputs 2px. With strict units on, Less assumes this is a bug in the calculation and throw an error.

        Returns:
        true whether the compiler should guess units in the Less code when it does maths, otherwise false.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        isStrictMath()

      • setStrictUnits

        public void setStrictUnits​(boolean strictUnits)
        Sets whether a compiler should guess units in Less code when it does maths (default: false). By default the compiler attempts to guess at the output unit when it does maths. For instance: 
         .class {
     property: 1px * 2px;
 }

        In this case, things are clearly not right - a length multiplied by a length gives an area, but CSS does not support specifying areas. So we assume that the user meant for one of the values to be a value, not a unit of length and Less outputs 2px. With strict units on, Less assumes this is a bug in the calculation and throw an error.

        Parameters:
        strictUnits - true whether the compiler should guess units in the Less code when it does maths, otherwise false.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        setStrictMath(boolean)

      • getSourceMapRootPath

        public String getSourceMapRootPath()
        Returns a path that will be prepended to each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also to the path to the map file specified in your output CSS (default: null).

        Use it if for instance you have a CSS file generated in the root on your web server but have your source less/css/map files in a different folder.

        Example: if you have a follow file structure: 

         output.css
 dev-files/output.css.map
 dev-files/output.less

        then you should set the Source Map root path to dev-files/.

        This option is the opposite of the Source Map base path option.

        Returns:
        the path which will be added.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        getSourceMapBasePath(), getSourceMapUrl()

      • setSourceMapRootPath

        public void setSourceMapRootPath​(String sourceMapRootPath)
        Sets a path that will be prepended to each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also to the path to the map file specified in your output CSS (default: null).

        Use it if for instance you have a CSS file generated in the root on your web server but have your source less/css/map files in a different folder.

        Example: if you have a follow file structure: 

         output.css
 dev-files/output.css.map
 dev-files/output.less

        then you should set the Source Map root path to dev-files/.

        This option is the opposite of the Source Map base path option.

        Parameters:
        sourceMapRootPath - the path which will be added.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        setSourceMapBasePath(String), setSourceMapUrl(String)

      • getSourceMapBasePath

        public String getSourceMapBasePath()
        Returns a path that will be removed from each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also from the path to the map file specified in your output CSS (default: null).

        It specifies a path which should be removed from the output paths. For instance if you are compiling a file in the less-files directory but the source files will be available on your web server in the root or current directory, you can specify this to remove the additional less-files part of the path.

        This option is the opposite of the Source Map root path option.

        Returns:
        the path which will be removed.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        getSourceMapRootPath(), getSourceMapUrl()

      • setSourceMapBasePath

        public void setSourceMapBasePath​(String sourceMapBasePath)
        Sets a path that will be removed from each of the Less file paths inside the Source Map and also from the path to the map file specified in your output CSS (default: null).

        It specifies a path which should be removed from the output paths. For instance if you are compiling a file in the less-files directory but the source files will be available on your web server in the root or current directory, you can specify this to remove the additional less-files part of the path.

        This option is the opposite of the Source Map root path option.

        Parameters:
        sourceMapBasePath - the path which will be removed.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        setSourceMapRootPath(String), setSourceMapUrl(String)

      • isSourceMapLessInline

        public boolean isSourceMapLessInline()
        Checks whether a compiler should include all of the Less files in to the Source Map (default: false). This means that you only need your map file to get to your original source.
        Returns:
        true whether the compiler should include all of the Less files in to the Source Map, otherwise false.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setSourceMapLessInline

        public void setSourceMapLessInline​(boolean sourceMapLessInline)
        Sets whether a compiler should include all of the Less files in to the Source Map (default: false). This means that you only need your map file to get to your original source.
        Parameters:
        sourceMapLessInline - true whether the compiler should include all of the Less files in to the Source Map, otherwise false.
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • getSourceMapUrl

        public String getSourceMapUrl()
        Returns a path which will overwrite the URL in the CSS that points at the Source Map file (default: null). This is for cases when the root path and the base path options are not producing exactly what you need.
        Returns:
        the Source Map URL.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        getSourceMapBasePath(), getSourceMapRootPath()

      • setSourceMapUrl

        public void setSourceMapUrl​(String sourceMapUrl)
        Sets a path which will overwrite the URL in the CSS that points at the Source Map file (default: null). This is for cases when the root path and the base path options are not producing exactly what you need.
        Parameters:
        sourceMapUrl - the Source Map URL.
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        setSourceMapBasePath(String), setSourceMapRootPath(String)

      • getGlobalVariables

        public List<LessVariableOption> getGlobalVariables()
        Returns global variables that can be referenced by the files (default: []. Effectively the declarations are put at the top of your base Less file, meaning those variables can be used, but they also can be overridden if variables with the same names are defined in the file.
        Returns:
        the global variables (never null).

      • setGlobalVariables

        public void setGlobalVariables​(List<LessVariableOption> globalVariables)
        Sets global variables that can be referenced by the files (default: []. Effectively the declarations are put at the top of your base Less file, meaning those variables can be used, but they also can be overridden if variables with the same names are defined in the file.
        Parameters:
        globalVariables - the global variables (null is treated as an empty collection).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        LessVariableOptionsBuilder

      • getModifyVariables

        public List<LessVariableOption> getModifyVariables()
        Returns modify variables that can overwrite variables defined in the files (default: []. Effectively the declarations are put at the bottom of your base Less file, meaning they will override anything defined in your Less file.
        Returns:
        the modify variables (never null).
        Since:
        2.0.0

      • setModifyVariables

        public void setModifyVariables​(List<LessVariableOption> modifyVariables)
        Sets modify variables that can overwrite variables defined in the files (default: []. Effectively the declarations are put at the bottom of your base Less file, meaning they will override anything defined in your Less file.
        Parameters:
        modifyVariables - the modify variables (null is treated as an empty collection).
        Since:
        2.0.0
        See Also:
        LessVariableOptionsBuilder
